intro: Habranthus itaobinus, commonly known as the Itaobine grass-violet, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Brazil. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, seed-filled capsules for reproduction. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
